questions.text: Who started playing in the football pool?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	The others played in the pool before but Diane just started to play. The football pool was where you pick who would win on a bunch of different football games. Whoever had the most wins for the week, won the pool.

questions.text: Who won the pool last week?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Sam was frustrated that Diane had won. Diane knew nothing about football.

questions.text: When was the last time Sam had won the pool?
questions.explanation:
1974.

	Sam questioned Diane's methods for picking teams. She asked him when the last time he had won and he said "1974 - but I've come close several times."

questions.text: How did Diane pick the Bears to beat the Dolphins?
questions.correct: It wasn't even a fair fight.
options: She just liked the Bears more than the Dolphins.
She saw who had the better statistics.
questions.explanation:
It wasn't even a fair fight.

	Diane had some interesting methods for picking teams. One of the ways was by picking teams whose city orchestras were led by foreign-born composers.

questions.text: Who tried to get Cliff to stand up to the bully?
questions.explanation:
Carla.

	Carla was always picking on Cliff. When someone else started to bully him she picked on him for not standing up to the man.

through Melville's.

	The bully was waiting for Cliff outside. The gang all thought Cliff was a chicken.

questions.correct: no blonde waitresses in the pool
options: no short people in the pool
questions.explanation:
no blonde waitresses in the pool.

	Sam was frustrated that Diane kept winning the pool when she knew nothing about football. She said that now she couldn't test her theory about cities whose symphonies have foreign-born conductors.

questions.text: Who was Cliff's co-worker whom he brought to Cheers?
questions.explanation:
Lewis.

	Lewis was played by Sam Scarber. Scarber was born June 24, 1949 in St. Louis, Missouri.

questions.text: What was Cliff's reason for not fighting?
questions.correct: He said he was a black belt in karate.
options: He once killed a man in a fight.
He just didn't feel like it.
questions.explanation:
He said he was a black belt in karate.

	Carla said that everyone who wanted to get out of a fight claimed to know karate. Diane was the only one who supported Cliff, believing he really did know karate.

questions.text: Who took Cliff to the hospital?
questions.explanation:
Diane.

	Cliff informed her that he never had a karate lesson in his life. He believed he may have broken some bones after he broke the wood.
